text: 'The food crushes it. My favorite pizza in town.  pasta dishes are great.   Terrific neighborhood place. Hidden gem.'

text: 'Very dissatisfied with the service. I felt very rushed and they charged us 2.50 for a side of ranch dressing!!! I‚Äôve never in my life seen a restaurant do that. The food was good it‚Äôs a shame because we would‚Äôve went back. We live in the area. Also they took advantage of the water advisory after the floods and charged 6 dollars for a bottle of water!!! author: Eric Hammer
text: "Been to Johnny Pepperoni's only twice but enjoyed both experiences.\n\nThe two experiences were very different. The first we ordered one or two apps (the burrata with prosciutto was *chefs kiss*) and a bunch of pies to split. That's the way to go in my opinion. I'd recommend the Mushroom & Fontina pie
column5: and the Sausage & Broccoli Rabe. Bottom line is you won't be disappointed with any of their pies.\n\nWhen I returned for my second visit
column6: my group had a different approach. Many wanted their own entrees
column7: so splitting pies was regrettably off the table. A few ordered chicken and fish dishes and seemed satisfied but not overly thrilled. I sampled the chicken parm which I surprisingly did not love. Mussels appetizer was fine. Arancini was good.\n\nTip: go with a group and order a bunch of pizzas. Bring wine (BYOB!!) and enjoy yourself. Solid Hoboken spot

text: 'Fun pizzeria hidden in Hoboken. Pizza quality was much better than expected. Buffalo wings were very tasty and meaty. Excellent service too!! Will go back for sure'

author: Jean-Claude Santini
text: 'I don\'t understand how this place has been here for at least nine years +
column5: and only has 2 reviews??? Very questionable and it concerns me greatly. I used to be a regular here food was and is always great and atmosphere to dine-in used to be awesome. Well after 6 or so years had passed
column6: i was in the area and i just ended up pushing myself to go there last night cause i remembered loving it
column7: and man let me tell you
column8: if it wasn\'t for that pepperoni!! I\'d be giving this play Zero Stars.\n\n***Long-haired dude that works there has got to tie his hair back and stop touching it every five seconds before he touches people\'s bread baskets and their utensils that they\'re going to eat with...!!!! Nasty
column9: clean your hands.***\n\nMaybe it was close to closing time when I went there like 9pm and they close at 10pm
column10: and I\'ve worked in restaurants before
column11: so I\'ve worked in tight quarters before
column12: but man they need to change the location where they restock their silverware and dry them
column13: it\'s right next to all the dining tables...it\'s loud ...it\'s obnoxious
column15: for about 40 minutes and which in fact is aTestament to the fact that they do work hard there because it didn\'t stop...but
column16: the fact is who wants to hear that banging and clanging the entire time you\'re sitting in a restaurant? Might as well turn off the radio
column17: I couldn\'t even hear the music.  What happened to Johnny Pepperoni? I might order take out
column19: hands down best place to eat if your a true Pepperoni lover
column21: id rather not have dandruff flakes hiding amongst my bread crumbs.  Seats and tables feel greasy and poorly cleaned.  I guess I\'ll just take mine to go.  Oh...waiter was good
column23: try to keep your personal conversations out of ear shot distance while your guests are eating.  Your working
column24: and im not there to hear your chit chat all the while with the clanging of spoons
column25: forks and knives in the background.  Ambiance "0"
column27: i respect your demeanor and communication skills were on point but
column28: be mindful of the environment.  Your serving $25 + items on a dinner menu
column29: that means big tips! But who wants to go and sit down and eat there with that background noise and that ambience
column30: it\'s terrible!!! I\'d rather just order pizza and take it to go cuz that\'s pretty much all this place is good for it seems
column31: it\'s a shame too because I\'m sure those entrees are good but I don\'t order entrees that are $30 to go home... I sit down and I enjoy it in a nice restaurant
column35: your tips are going to be a lot less
column36: so be mindful of the environment that you\'re working in.. that\'s your bread and butter... build your customer base by not making their experience there a nightmare.... that\'s my advice. In the end
column37: I\'m not willing to risk going there again so you\'re not going to make much tip money from me.  Good luck...'

author: Juan Jose San Segundo
text: 'The best'

author: e collins
text: 'We have been regularly visiting this restaurant for about six years now. It has become our family‚Äôs favorite in Hoboken. We‚Äôve tried most of the items on their menu
column5: and have never had a bad meal. Service has always been great. We‚Äôve brought many out of town guests here ... whenever they return to Hoboken they always ask to go back to Johnny‚Äôs. More than just a pizza place - the balance of their menu is solid. Nice ambiance

text: 'Quaint little Italian eatery with a wonderful collection of old time photos throughout.  We ordered a plain cheese pizza and Caesar salad and the pizza was very good with excellent cheese and a great crunchy crust.  The sauce was plain
column5: though

column7: clean-tasting with a tasty Caesar dressing.  Great service and about $40 for a pizza

text: "Been here 3 times and it always smells like dirty mop. Great pizza but u won't be able to stomach the stench and eat your pizza at the same time. Sit outside or order out if the mop don't bother u lol"

text: 'My family and I were visiting and happened upon this amazing pizzeria!! The pizza was fresh and savory! Truly a slice of heaven! The service was superb and the entire staff had a welcoming spirit.  One of the employees even came out and helped us take a family photo at closing!'

Kids menu including chicken fingers and fries.  Friendly staff.  It gets busy at dinner time so either get there before 7pm or make a reservation.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "I love pizza. My boyfriend loves pizza. So we decided to slowly hit up all the pizza spots in Hoboken (not all at once). Johnny Pepperoni had been on our list for a while because we always passed by it on the way to/from Trader Joe's. One snowstormy day
column5: we found ourselves with no dinner
column6: and had a small case of cabin fever. So we decided to place an order and trek on over to pick up some pizza.\n\nTo start
column7: we ordered a side of the arancini (Sicilian-style rice fritters
column10: which I didn't like. Somethaing didn't taste right with the cheese - like they might have mixed some cheddar cheese
column11: or kraft singles in it.\n\nFor the pizza
column12: we had the Mushroom and Fontina pie (white pizza
column17: garlic and thyme). Now I don't know if maybe I just don't like white pizza
column18: or if it was just too much going on
column19: but I didn't like it as much as I was expecting it to. It was pretty heavy. On the plus side
column20: there were a decent amount of mushrooms on the pie; I just wish they had spread it out more evenly.\n\nPerhaps their pies would taste better if you dine in
column21: so I wouldn't mind going back to try a different pizza

author: Myles Helfand
text: 'Absolutely outstanding pizza and pasta dishes
column5: served in a small setting with a consciously old-school casual Italian feel. Just wish we got more appetizers for the money: the clams oreganatta and Caesar salad in particular are such small portions!'

text: 'Always good... Great BYOB Italian restaurant

text: 'The sweet and spicy sausage sandwich is amazing'

author: Stephen Desautels
text: "Horrendous service. We were told that the wait would be 20-30 minutes
column5: and that they would call us when the table was ready. We waited for a full hour with still no call
column6: so we called them to ask for an update. After being put on hold twice
column7: we were told that the wait would be another 20 minutes. If they can't even get us a table I'm not going to consider going there again."

text: "We absolutely love this place.  I don't know of a more kid-friendly restaurant in town.  The staff must be commended...really a fantastic and authentic crew.  And
column5: in case you're wondering

author: Les Williams
text: 'Johnny Pepperoni is your new chic modern industrial design pizzeria/restaurant. With exposed brick and high ceilings
column5: with floor to ceiling doors that open to outdoor seating and lots of sunlight and fresh air.\n\nThe pizza is think crust and quite amazing. We had a side of the meatballs which proved to be good. But our favorite non pizza dish at this place is the Baked Shrimp Scampi (Tiger shrimp
column6: lemon
column10: parsley and grilled garlic bread).\n\nThe vibe here great and the staff are great. Moderately priced too!'

text: 'Get the wings!'

text: 'Noisy

text: 'Our FAVE'

author: Janice Miranda
text: "The pizza is delicious and my 2 year old enjoys the pies.  If i rated this place solely on the pizza
column5: it would be a 4.\nI am highly disappointed however in the clams oreganata from the perspective of price
column6: taste
column7:
and execution.
First- The clams are tiny; I took a picture next to a quarter to give you an idea. Sadness!
Second- An order costs you $14 for six of these sorry little molluscs.
Third- The bread crumbs were bland. The lemon helps give them some flavor other than cardboard.
Fourth - The clam itself is non-existent buried within all the breadcrumbs.
Do yourself a favor and stick to the pizza. Don't order the clams oreganata."

column5:
soggy pizza

-In the end it didn't even taste good I would rather go to shoprite and buy frozen pizza.

Thanks for nothing Johnny Pepperoni..."

author: Andrew Schaich
text: 'UPDATE March 2016:\n\nDO NOT EAT HERE. They don\'t care if they get your order right or not
column5: they don\'t care to correct their mistakes (in fact
column6: they expect you to pay for their mistakes). They then ignore you when you try to bring it to their attention.\n\nI rarely go after places who make mistakes
column7: it happens (we\'re all human). It all comes down to
column8:
how you rebound after a mistake. Well this places is the worst!

Very confused why they are the worst restaurant in Hoboken?...
‚Ä¢ On 3x occasions they took the order wrong!
‚Ä¢ They contacted me to apologize and offer to correct the situation
column9:
but...
‚Ä¢ They asked for my contact info.
‚Ä¢ They said John the owner will make it right.
‚Ä¢ After no word
column10:
I followed up twice without an answer.
REALLY?!?!
THey decided to take 3x bad situations and made it worse.
FOR SHAME. SERIOUSLY NOW THEY ARE INTENTIONALLY SCREWING WITH CUSTOMERS!!!

---
February 2016:

Tonight at 7:45pm is the THIRD (3x) time they can't get an order right - I order the same thing each time "1x Square Deep Pepperoni Pie" and the last three (3x) times they try and give me a Large Round Pepperoni Pie $17.

Worst was today
column11: I asked the hostess on the phone to read it back  and quote me the higher $22+ price. So after waiting an hour
column12:
I refused this pie when they tried to pawn off the large round pie for $17 or wait another 30 minutes for them to remake the order.

This happened in October and November where I begrudgingly paid and took their pizza mishaps.

Really
column13: how hard is it to get an order right that\'s your actual restaurant name?!? Your excuses were old the second time

author: Jonathan Goodelman
text: "Johnny Pepperoni
column5: is an excellent neighborhood restaurant
column6: the food is absolutely amazing
column7: I have never ordered anything I didn't like. Additionally
column9: they are usually extremely busy on Friday and Saturday nights but they do a wonderful job of making you feel as if you are the only ones in the restaurant. Rich
column10: Dom as well as the whole staff keep me coming back week after week. I feel like I am eating at home with friends. Johnny Pepperoni is a must go to in Hoboken."

author: Rachel Silberman
text: 'I was walking around the area and saw Johnny Pepperoni. It looked like a good restaurant; there were families outside eating pizza
column5: and I wanted to experience that. I walk in and ask for a menu
column6: then I find what I want and ask to be seated. Instead
column7: the hostess refused to seat me and took my order. I thought maybe after I gave her my order she\'d sit me down
column8: but when I asked where I can be seated she told me the bar. I told the hostess that I wanted to dine in and be seated
column9: and she looked at me and said "Oh
column10: I thought it was a to-go order" and STILL didn\'t seat me
column11: even though the restaurant was full of empty seats. I just stood there waiting and the girl just looked at me. How else can I word "I want to dine in"? I\'m appalled I was refused service
column12: offended on how the hostess treated me
column13: and confused because I would have given Johnny Pepperoni more money. I don\'t even know why I paid for my pizza. Like hell I\'d stay there and eat at the bar with my pizza in a box. Do yourself a favor and try somewhere else.'

author: John Rutter
text: 'One of the best "fancy pizza" places in town. Ricotta bruschetta toast points are my favorite app. Pizzas are excellent.'

author: soraya piergrossi
text: 'We used to love ordering from Johnny Pepperoni for the past couple of years. They always delivered to us no problem
column5: we live 10 minutes away. But earlier this week and tonight
column6: we tried to place an order and tonight we were told "they no longer deliver to our neighborhood". Seriously?! After ordering from them from over two years?! And the employee who answered the phone wasn\'t even nice or professional about it. We live in a large building and they just lost a good handful of customers. As someone who works in customer service (and in the food industry for almost 20 years) I am just appalled with their "customer service" and lack of professionalism.'

author: Cardiff Giant
text: "The pizza was really nothing to brag about.  Similar to Grimaldis
column5: and maybe not fully cooked when they brought it out (little doughy). However
column6: their chicken al diavolo was the most delicious chicken I've ever eaten in a restaurant. Flavored perfectly
column8: even my friend who doesn't like chicken said it was amazing."

author: Brad Catalano
text: "I was there this past Friday night and had a great dining experience with my family!  I ordered a pizza with pepperoni and roasted red peppers and it was outstanding. (Who says NYC has the best pizza?)  I taste tested all the pasta dishes that everyone else ordered and all were delicious.  I highly recommend this place if you're ever in Hoboken
column5:
N.J.  Our kind of place!

Brad from Pittsburgh
GO STEELERS!!!"

author: Olivier Gillier
text: 'Very Good pizza. Neighbourhood gem.'

author: Mariano Barrera
text: 'I ATTENDED A FUNDRAISER AT THE PIZZERIA TO COLLECT MONEY FOR THE HOBOKEN SHELTER.\nTHE PIZZA WAS SOOOO GOOD.. AND THE SERVICE IS OUTSTANDING. THE STAFF WAS VERY ‚Ä¶'
